subsections.title: Definition
subsections.content: Decision making involves selecting the best option among alternatives.
points: We make decisions every day, big or small.
Poor decisions can lead to negative outcomes; good ones improve life quality.

subsections.title: Steps in Decision Making
subsections.content: A structured process improves decision quality.
points: Identify the problem.
Gather relevant information.
Evaluate options.
Make a choice.
Take action and review the results.

subsections.title: Importance
subsections.content: Making wise choices improves various aspects of life.
points: Improves health, relationships, and long-term success.
Builds responsibility and independence.

subsections.title: Definition
subsections.content: Self-awareness is understanding your own emotions, strengths, weaknesses, and values.
points: It involves being honest with yourself.
Helps you know how others see you.

subsections.title: Benefits
points: Increases confidence and emotional intelligence.
Leads to better relationships and decisions.

subsections.title: How to Improve Self-Awareness
subsections.content: It is a skill that can be developed.
points: Reflect regularly on your behavior and feelings.
Seek feedback from trusted people.
Practice mindfulness or journaling.

subsections.title: Definition
subsections.content: Peer pressure is the influence from people of your own age group.
points: It can affect thoughts, decisions, and behavior.

subsections.title: Types of Peer Pressure
subsections.content: It can be either helpful or harmful.
points: Positive: Encourages studying, good habits.
Negative: Encourages drugs, truancy, or risky behavior.

subsections.title: Resisting Negative Peer Pressure
subsections.content: It is important to stand firm in your values.
points: Say no firmly and clearly.
Give a reason or make an excuse.
Avoid bad company or situations.
Seek support from trusted adults or friends.
